title: Dungeons & Dragons Rolltables
description: A compendium of 5e compatible rolltables generated by ChatGPT.

campaignEntries.rawText:
## Melee
| d20 Roll | Critical Failure Effect |
|---|---|
| 1 | Your weapon slips from your hand and lands 10 feet in a random direction. |
| 2 | You strike a solid surface with your weapon, dealing its minimum damage to it instead. |
| 3 | You overextend yourself in your attack, becoming unbalanced. Your speed is halved until the start of your next turn. |
| 4 | Your attack ricochets back, dealing the weapon's minimum damage to yourself. |
| 5 | You stumble and fall prone. |
| 6 | You leave an opening in your defense. The next attack against you has advantage. |
| 7 | Your weapon becomes lodged in a nearby object or surface and requires a successful Strength check to free. |
| 8 | Your weapon suffers a -1 penalty to damage rolls until repaired. |
| 9 | You twist awkwardly during your swing shifting your armor. Until you spend an action to fix it, your AC is reduced by 1. |
| 10 | You hit an unintended target (determined by the DM) with your attack instead. |
| 11 | Your attack misses completely, causing you to spin around and becoming disoriented. You can't take reactions until the start of your next turn. |
| 12 | Your weapon's string, strap, or handle breaks, rendering it unusable until repaired. |
| 13 | Your overreach leaves you vulnerable, your opponent can make one melee attack against you as a reaction. |
| 14 | Your weapon strikes a nearby object, creating a loud noise that attracts nearby entities. |
| 15 | Your weapon clatters to the ground at your feet. Picking it up requires an action. |
| 16 | You strike yourself lightly, taking 1 point of bludgeoning damage. |
| 17 | You strain a muscle during your swing. Your Strength or Dexterity (your choice) is reduced by 1 until you finish a short or long rest. |
| 18 | You lose your grip and throw your weapon, it lands 15 feet in a random direction. |
| 19 | The recoil from your attack leaves you temporarily blind. You are blinded until the start of your next turn. |
| 20 | During your attack, you trip and fall, becoming prone. Additionally, you accidentally kick your weapon 5 feet away from you. |

## Ranged
| d20 roll | Mishap |
| --- | --- |
| 1 | Your weapon backfires, dealing its normal damage to you.
| 2 | Your projectile veers off course, striking the nearest ally for half damage.
| 3 | Your projectile veers off course, striking a random object. Roll to determine if the object is destroyed.
| 4 | Your projectile snaps in half upon firing, making you take 1d4 piercing damage.
| 5 | Your bowstring snaps, rendering the weapon unusable until repaired.
| 6 | Your weapon slips from your grip, landing 1d10 feet away in a random direction.
| 7 | Your ranged attack ricochets, crashing into an unintended object, it could draw unwanted attention.
| 8 | Your failed attempt seizes your weapon; it won't function again until you spend an action to fix it.
| 9 | You overextend your shot, causing strain. The next attack roll made within 24 hours is at disadvantage.
| 10 | Your ammunition is flawed, causing it to explode upon firing. Deal 1d6 fire damage to yourself.
| 11 | Your attack shakes your combat readiness. You lose your next bonus action. 
| 12 | Your mishap dislocates your shoulder. Suffer -1 to all attack rolls until you can take a short or long rest.
| 13 | You stumble during your attack, moving 5 feet in a random direction, potentially causing opportunity attacks.
| 14 | Your grip slips, and the weapon goes flying from your hand, landing 2d6 feet in a random direction.
| 15 | A string, cord, or linkage on your gear catches, causing your whole ranged setup to unravel. It takes one full action to get it ready again.
| 16 | You misjudge the wind and your aim deviates widely, potentially alerting enemies to your presence.
| 17 | Your mishandling of the weapon causes it to jam. You must succeed a DC15 Dexterity check to unjam it.
| 18 | Your attack goes extremely wide, potentially causing a cave-in or rockslide if in an unstable area.
| 19 | Your released missile goes wildly off course, potentially hitting an object of sentimental importance.
| 20 | You draw too powerfully, your ranged weapon snaps causing damage equal to the weapon's die to yourself. |

## Arcane
**d20 Rolltable: Arcane Mishaps from a Critical Failure**

| d20 Roll | Effect |
|-------------|-------------------------------------------------|
| 1 | A surge of arcane energy backlashes, causing you to take damage equal to the spell level. |
| 2 | You inadvertently open a temporary portal to a random plane of existence. A harmless but often alarming entity appears and immediately flees. |
| 3 | The misfired spell causes your arcane focus to shatter, rendering it useless. |
| 4 | Spells cast by you cause sensory hallucinations in a 20-foot radius until dispelled. |
| 5 | The misdirected magic amplifies auditory senses around you - your party's Stealth checks will be at disadvantage for the next hour. |
| 6 | The spell's fallout causes gravity to fluctuate within a 30 foot radius. This unpredictable gravity lasts for 1d4 rounds. |
| 7 | Arcane energy swirls around you wildly, reducing your movement speed by half for 10 minutes. |
| 8 | The failed spell forms a short-lived but terrifying illusory image of a powerful monster. |
| 9 | Your magic distorts the fabric of reality temporarily. For the next minute, time seems to slow down for everyone but you. |
| 10 | Your arcane magic lashes out, randomly banishing an unattended object within a 10 foot radius to another plane of existence. |
| 11 | Your spell rebounds to imbue the nearest adversary with a minor, random boon for 1d4 rounds. |
| 12 | The spell discharges a burst of light, blinding you for 1d4 rounds. |
| 13 | You temporally lost control over your magic. Your spells are replaced with random cantrips for 1d4 rounds. |
| 14 | Your spell arcs off course, creating an elemental creature of the spell's type that is hostile to you. |
| 15 | Your magic implode inwards. You cannot use magic and have disadvantage on all attacks for 1d4 rounds. |
| 16 | Errant arcane explosion makes all creatures within 20 ft radius Deafened for 1d4 rounds. |
| 17 | Your misfire creates an aura of arcane energy around you. All allies within 10 ft radius lose Resistances and Immunities for 1 minute. |
| 18 | The spell unexpectedly splits, affecting a random secondary target with a halved dice roll. |
| 19 | The force of the magical mishap sends you flying 10 feet in the opposite direction. |
| 20 | Arcane energy builds up inside you. Your next spell has a 50% chance to fail, but if it succeeds, it counts as a critical success. |

## Melee
| d20 Roll | Boon |
|---------|---------|
| 1 | Your critical hit opens up an opportunity for an ally, granting them advantage on their next attack. |
| 2 | Your hit inspires your allies. They each gain a d4 that they can add to a check, attack or saving throw within the next minute. |
| 3 | Your strike resonates with power, causing your target to take an additional die of damage. |
| 4 | Your hit disorients your target. Their speed is reduced by half until the start of your next turn. |
| 5 | Your devastating strike agitates the environment, causing small objects to be hurled at other enemies, dealing 1d4 damage to them. |
| 6 | Your powerful strike leaves a lingering impact. The target has disadvantage on its next attack roll.  |
| 7 | Your strike is so overwhelming that the target is stunned until the end of its next turn. |
| 8 | Your hit is so well-placed that the target gets pushed 10ft away from you. |
| 9 | Your critical hit leaves the target vulnerable, and it takes double damage from the next attack that hits it before the end of your next turn. |
| 10 | Your melee attack disarms your target. Horizontal blows force the target to drop an item of your choice that itâ€™s holding. |
| 11 | Your strike causes your weapon to glow with power until the start of your next turn. The next creature hit by it takes additional radiant damage equal to your level. |
| 12 | Your melee attack scares all enemies within 20ft of you, causing them to have disadvantage on their next attack. |
| 13 | Your successful attack leaves your target off balance. Your target has disadvantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks until the start of your next turn. |
| 14 | Your powerful hits grant you a shield of momentum. Gain temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt to the enemy. |
| 15 | Your hit explodes with force and shrapnel, imposing disadvantage on the target's next attack roll or ability check. |
| 16 | You are in perfect sync with your weapon, granting you +2 to Armor Class until the start of your next turn. |
| 17 | Your melee hit allows you to immediately make one additional attack as a bonus action. |
| 18 | Your hit shocks the opponent, causing it to be silenced until the end of its next turn. |
| 19 | Your critical hit connects with such force that the target is knocked prone. |
| 20 | In a stunning display of skill and precision, your hit causes maximum damage. |

## Ranged
| d20 Roll | Boons due to a Critical Success on a Ranged Attack |
| --- | --- |
| 1 | The attack deals max damage, then roll the damage dice again and add the total. |
| 2 | The projectile pierces through the target, potentially hitting another target behind it. |
| 3 | Stunning shot. The target is stunned until the end of your next turn. |
| 4 | The target drops whatever it is holding as your shot hits its hand or equivalent. |
| 5 | Your ranged attack disorients the target, giving it disadvantage on its next attack roll. |
| 6 | Your attack shatters the target's armor or natural armor, reducing its AC by 1 until repaired/restored. |
| 7 | Your attack causes the target to be knocked prone. |
| 8 | The critical hit causes a major wound, the target loses 1 hit point each round until healed. |
| 9 | Your shot hits the target in a sensitive area, reducing their speed by half until healed. |
| 10 | The critical hit causes the target to be blinded until the end of its next turn. |
| 11 | Double the range of your next ranged attack due to an improved understanding of your weapon. |
| 12 | You find a weak point in your target's defense. Your next attack roll on the same target has advantage. |
| 13 | Your attack inspires fear to observers. Enemies within 30 feet of the target must succeed a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you until the end of your next turn. |
| 14 | The shot ricochets off the target into another, roll another attack for the second target. |
| 15 | Your shot makes a loud impact echoing through the vicinity and all creatures within 60 feet are aware of your location. |
| 16 | Your target is pushed 10 feet back from the force of the blow. |
| 17 | Disrupting shot. The target canâ€™t take reactions until the end of its next turn. |
| 18 | Your critical success grants you immediate insight. Gain advantage on the next attack roll against this target. |
| 19 | Pathfinding shot. You can see the shortest path to the target until the end of the combat. |
| 20 | Fatality shot. If the target's hit points are 10 or lower, it is slain instantly. |

## Arcane
| D20 Roll | Boon Due to Critical Success on Arcane Attack |
|----------|----------------------------------------------|
| 1        | Arcane energy lingers, providing a +2 bonus to the next attack roll. |
| 2        | A surge of magic strengthens your body, temporarily increasing your maximum hit points by 4. |
| 3        | Your spell resonates with the energies of the Weave, causing your next spell to consume half the usual spell slot. |
| 4        | Your next successful arcane attack is imbued with a minor smite, dealing an additional 1d6 damage. |
| 5        | The arcane energy allows you a glimpse into the future. You gain advantage on the next saving throw. |
| 6        | Your next cantrip is treated as if cast at one level higher than your current. |
| 7        | The arcane energy forms a temporary barrier, providing +2 AC for one round. |
| 8        | Your magic brims with vitality, restoring 1d4 hit points to you or an ally within 30 feet. |
| 9        | Your spell leaves a smouldering glyph on the target that aids your sight, giving advantage on the next attack against it. |
| 10       | The echo of your spell strengthens you, granting temporary resistance to one damage type of your choice for one round. |
| 11       | Your spellword resonates in the world, causing your next spell to require no verbal component. |
| 12       | The arcane energies fortify your body, temporarily increasing your Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution by +1 for one hour. |
| 13       | You channel extra energy into your spell, causing your next spell of 1st level or higher to deal an additional 1d4 damage. |
| 14       | Your arcane attack rebounds, and your target takes an additional 1d6 force damage. |
| 15       | The spell's potency gives you a surge of confidence, granting advantage on the next Charisma-based check or saving throw. |
| 16       | Tendrils of magic reach out to your allies, providing them a +1 bonus to their next attack roll. |
| 17       | Your successful attack resonates with arcane power, forcing your opponents to make a saving throw against being pushed 10 feet away from you. |
| 18       | Your spell lands with perfect accuracy, bypassing any damage resistance the target may have. |
| 19       | You rejuvenate some spell energy, recovering a used spell slot of a level lower than the spell just cast. |
| 20       | Your arcane attack overflows with energy, hitting an additional target within range. |

| 3 | Sunflight Swiftfeather | Tall, with an air of unyielding authority. His eyes display a depth of wisdom beyond his years. |
| 4 | Skywatcher Fleetwing | Stoic and alert, her feathered brow never seems to relax. Her piercing gaze never misses a detail. |
| 5 | Windcaller Stormclaw | A figure marshaled by the harshest winds, with a quiet aura of commanding respect. |

| 10 | Cloudhunter Skytalon | Silent and resolute, but beneath her calm demeanor lies a sharp strategic mind. |
| 11 | Swiftflight Emberplume | Fierce and daunting, she commands respect with her hawk-like gaze and battle-hardened stance. |
| 12 | Windwalker Dustbeak | A shadowy figure whose stern demeanor speaks of countless battles weathered. |
| 13 | Stormchaser Dawnclaw | An ancient warrior, whose bright feathers contrast dark eyes filled with wisdom and secrets. |
| 14 | Ironveil Sunwing | Stern, yet commanding, his swift movements hint at a lifetime of combat. |
| 15 | Stormbearer Mistfeather | A brooding figure, his solemn expression betrays years of survival against untold challenges. |
| 16 | Moonshadow Eagletalon | Stoic, with a thousand-yard stare that bespeaks years of sacrifices made in the line of duty. |
| 17 | Windtreader Frostbeak | A grizzled veteran of many storms, his piercing gaze betrays a strong and resilient spirit. |
| 18 | Thundercaller Starwing | Steely-eyed and noble, his stern gaze and firm posture speak volumes of his leadership. |
| 19 | Stormwatcher Peakplume | Deriving strength from years of battle, her scarred beak betrays a tumultuous past. |
| 20 | Raindancer Cloudfeather | Brooding and foreboding, her sense of seriousness can be felt by all those around her. |

## Changeling
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Erevan | A somber Changeling with silver eyes whose true form features sharp facial features and thin lips. As a rogue, he changes shape to gather information. |
| 2 | Silaqui | An elusive Changeling sorcerer, her true form has amethyst eyes and wavy hair. She relies on her changeling abilities to deceive enemies. |
| 3 | Fenris | A Changeling cleric with milky white eyes in their true form. Known for their somber personality, they takes on the guise of an old sage during journeys. |
| 4 | Aelar | A reserved Changeling paladin with smooth skin and large green eyes in their true form, they use their shape-shifting abilities to scout enemy lines. |
| 5 | Ilithra | A stern Changeling warlock, who prefers to remain in her true form displaying her silvery hair and pale yellow eyes. |
| 6 | Daelis | A Changeling bard with silver-white eyes whose real form has uniquely pointed ears. He uses his shape-changing ability to charm and entertain. |
| 7 | Eilin | She is a reserved Changeling druid. Her true form displays solid blue eyes. She uses her shifting abilities to blend into natural surroundings. |
| 8 | Cailan | A stoic Changeling fighter with flat facial features and smooth skin in their true form adopts the forms of formidable warriors to battle foes. |
| 9 | Idril | A daunting Changeling ranger with pure white hair and almond-shaped eyes in true form. She uses her transformative skills to track and hunt. |
| 10 | Arannis | A formidable Changeling wizard, his true form has lavender eyes and thin lips. He manipulates his form for various magical research and incantations. |
| 11 | Namirin | An austere Changeling monk, whose true form is bald with sea-green eyes. He utilizes his unique abilities for meditation and spiritual exploration. |
| 12 | Onnim | A serious Changeling artificer, with opaque white eyes in their true form. They often take on the guise of skilled craftspeople to apply their trades. |
| 13 | Quenell | A stern Changeling rogue. Her true form has short, fine hair with angular facial features. She utilizes her shifting abilities for espionage. |
| 14 | Tholamin | This somber Changeling cleric rarely leaves their true form showing his colorless eyes and hair. They heal others under the guise of different races. |
| 15 | Daemar | He is an introspective Changeling paladin with soft blue eyes in his true form. Adopts the forms of indomitable knights in his quest for justice. |
| 16 | Miral | A stoic Changeling warrior, her true form features tall and lanky build with deep-set eyes. She changes form to adapt in warfare. |
| 17 | Haliar | A stern, seasoned Changeling ranger. His true form displays pearl-white hair and eyes. He uses his shifting ability for ultimate survival. |
| 18 | Veradin | A serious Changeling wizard with soft blue eyes in their true form. Frequently changes forms to tap into their magical prowess from different perspectives. |
| 19 | Galadon | A Changeling sorcerer with solid silver eyes and smooth skin in their true form. He manipulates his form to execute mysterious arcane rituals. |
| 20 | Luthra | She is a hardened Changeling rogue, whose true form features slender build and solid black eyes. Makes use of her abilities for stealthy operations. |

## Dragonborn
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|---|---|---|
